text: Chinese and US officials are meeting in
Washington for annual talks yes two of
the world's biggest economic and
strategic competitors sitting across the
table from one another so what does the
world actually think of them both a
survey of 40 countries by the Pew
Research Center asked that very question
remember how during the Great Recession
many people said the u.s. was losing out
to China as an economic superpower well
you can see here that there's actually
been a rise in the number of people who
think the u.s. is still on top take a
look at India in particular a country
being courted by the US and China as a
major trading partner it's seen the
biggest gain and people who think the
u.s. is the top economy but it's not all
bad news for China when it comes to
superpower status most surveyed said
China will replace the US as the
preeminent superpower or that it already
has the European Union home to some of
America's closest allies is actually the
most convinced Chinese supremacy is
inevitable while the Asia Pacific region
is the most divided on who will win out
China's overall favorability is growing
across the world but especially in
Africa where it's made big investments
so the race between China and America
continues but for now the officials meet
in Washington to see where their goals
coincide and where they don't
David Botti BBC News Washington
